analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las gzhan rnam pa gsum yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: The result is the three results other than the result of the stream-enterer.

original: 'bras bu khyad par can ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i 'og rol gyis zhugs pa'i lam mam khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par can ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i 'og rol gyis zhugs pa'i lam mam khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The distinguished result is the path of candidate or the path of advancement following the result of the stream-enterer.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gnyis kho na brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gnyis kho na brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The master Sa·πÉghabhadra says that only two should be mentioned.

original: dbang po sbyangs pa ni 'bras bu thob pa brjod de gzung ba'i phyir der yang 'bras bu thob pas ni lam snga ma 'dor ro //
analyzed: dbang po sbyangs pa ni 'bras bu thob pa brjod de gzung ba'i phyir der yang 'bras bu thob pas ni lam snga ma 'dor ro //
translated: The acquisition of the result of the once-returner, etc., is not mentioned because it is included in the acquisition of the result of the stream-enterer.

original: 'dir 'bras bu 'am 'bras bu khyad par can la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu 'am 'bras bu khyad par can la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two alternatives for the result or the distinguished result.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni 'bras bu khyad par can lam la rjes su shes pa thob pas 'dor ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni 'bras bu khyad par can lam la rjes su shes pa thob pas 'dor ro //
translated: The path of seeing is relinquished by obtaining the special result, the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.üîΩThe special is not both like the former, and the former is both like that.

original: mi g-yo bar bsdus pa'i chos rnams gnyi ga ji ltar bar khyad par can ma yin la /üîΩslar yang gnyi ga ji lta ba ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo bar bsdus pa'i chos rnams gnyi ga ji ltar bar khyad par can ma yin la / slar yang gnyi ga ji lta ba ste /
translated: However, the special is not both like the former, because it is not relinquished by changing level and it is not relinquished by obtaining the result.üîΩThe former is both like that, because it is relinquished by both changing level and obtaining the result.

original: de lta mod kyi dbang po sbyangs pas 'bras bu tsam thob pa de lta na yang der dbang po sbyangs pa kho na rgyu yin pas bar chod med par so sor bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dbang po sbyangs pas 'bras bu tsam thob pa de lta na yang der dbang po sbyangs pa kho na rgyu yin pas bar chod med par so sor bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, even though one obtains the mere result of once return by upgrading one's intellectual faculty, it is explained that it is relinquished without impediment because upgrading one's intellectual faculty is the cause for that.

original: zag pa med pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin @48b pa'i phyir sa 'phos pas mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin @48b pa'i phyir sa 'phos pas mi gtong ngo //
translated: Uncontaminated vows are not relinquished by changing level because they are not concomitant states.

original: yang sdom pa ma yin pa can gyi sdom pa ji lta 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang sdom pa ma yin pa can gyi sdom pa ji lta 'thob ce na /
translated: How do those who possess negative commitments obtain vows?

original: de'i phyir gal te sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la zhes bya ba smos te so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la zhes bya ba smos te so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'o //

original: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa thob na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa thob na zhes bya ba la /

original: zag pa med pa'i sdom pa thob na zhes ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sdom pa thob na zhes ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /

original: zag pa med pa'i sngon du bsam gtan gyi sdom pa 'gro ba'i phyir la /üîΩbsam gtan gyi sdom pa kho nas bor pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i sdom pa thob na zhes ma brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sngon du bsam gtan gyi sdom pa 'gro ba'i phyir la / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa kho nas bor pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i sdom pa thob na zhes ma brjod do //
translated: Because the absorption vows precede the uncontaminated vows.üîΩAnd because one loses the uncontaminated vows only through losing the absorption vows, it is not said that one obtains uncontaminated vows.

original: yang sdom pa ma yin pa can gyis bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ji ltar 'thob ce na rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang sdom pa ma yin pa can gyis bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ji ltar 'thob ce na rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs zhes bya ba smos te /

original: rgyu'i stobs ni sdar gyi bsam gtan goms pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs ni sdar gyi bsam gtan goms pa'o //
translated: The power of the cause is the prior habituation to absorption.

original: rkyen gyi sdom pa ni sa de pa'i las rnam par smin pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi sdom pa ni sa de pa'i las rnam par smin pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: The power of the condition is the ripening of karma of that level that is about to manifest.

original: gzhan dag na re dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Listening to the excellent teaching and properly contemplating it.

original: gnyen po stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdom pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdom pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the antidote is powerful means because the vows are powerful.

original: lus bor pa'i phyir shi ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus bor pa'i phyir shi ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the body is lost means because one dies.

original: ris mthun pa'i stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is obtained by the power of homogeneous

original: de dang bral na de med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo dang mda'i 'gros bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo 'am /
analyzed: de dang bral na de med pa'i phyir ro // rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo dang mda'i 'gros bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo 'am /
translated: character, and because it does not exist when one is separated from it.üîΩIt is like the wheel of a potter or the momentum of an arrow.

analyzed: mda'i 'gros 'du byed kyi khyad par gyis 'phang pa ni 'du byed kyi khyad par de chad pas 'chad de de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the wheel of a potter or the momentum of an arrow, which is projected by a special volition, is interrupted by the interruption of that special volition, so too is the life force.üîΩIt is like the momentum of a sling

analyzed: gdos dang rgyal sogs pa'i dngos po'o zhes bya ba la /

translated: When one gives a sling or a crossbow to another, the noninformative action that is projected is interrupted when the object that one has appropriated for oneself is interrupted.üîΩThe roots of virtue

original: dge pa'i rtsa ba rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge pa'i rtsa ba rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba gcad pa'i sbyor ba kho nas bar ma mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pas te dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa las zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /

analyzed: sbyor ba la de'i sgra nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gtong ngo //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdun pa brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: dper na yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dbang ba lta bu'o //

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni khams gsum pa'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar nyon mongs pa yang yin no //

analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu ni chen po'i chen po'i yin no //

original: 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútogether with its retinue‚Äù means

analyzed: rten gnyis ka'i nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la / de dag ni skyes pa dang yang sbyor bar 'dod la /
translated: Because the two bases have a predominance of afflictions.üîΩThey desire to unite with men.

original: bud med dang yang sbyor bar 'dod de /
analyzed: bud med dang yang sbyor bar 'dod de /
translated: They desire to unite with women.

original: de'i phyir skyes pa dang bud med kyi rten gyi nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir de'i gnyen por gyur pa so sor rtog pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa dang bud med kyi rten gyi nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir de'i gnyen por gyur pa so sor rtog pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: The faculty of sorrow is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of dissatisfaction.üîΩThe faculty of indifference is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of faith.üîΩThe faculty of conceptual identification is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of conceptualization.

analyzed: byanta ra sya hi kle sha sa mu da ts'a ro pi byantar ae be ti / ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The faculty of life force is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of pleasure.üîΩThe faculty of one who has more to learn is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of final knowledge is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.

translated: The faculty of final knowledge is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of one who has more to learn is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of perfect knowledge is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of final knowledge is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of one who has more to learn is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: sdom pa med pa'i rgyur bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni sdom pa ma yin pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pas /
analyzed: sdom pa med pa'i rgyur bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni sdom pa ma yin pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pas /
translated: The faculty of perfect knowledge is not a root of non-restraint, because it is not a universal cause of non-restraint, like the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: 'o na sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
analyzed: 'o na sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
translated: The faculty

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni yang dag par len pa med pa'i phyir so sor thar ba'i sngom pa med de //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni yang dag par len pa med pa'i phyir so sor thar ba'i sngom pa med de //
translated: Those of Uttarakuru do not have pratimoksa vows because they do not correctly take them.

original: ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag med do //üîΩyang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag med do // yang ci'i phyir /
translated: They do not have the absorptions of meditative stabilization and uncontaminated vows because they do not have concentration.

analyzed: de rnams la yang dag par len pa dang ting nge 'dzin dag med ce na /
translated: Why do they not have correct taking and concentration?

analyzed: shes rab zhan pas dge ba la sogs pa'i chos la ma byang @49b pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi rnams la gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rnams la gsum mo zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni mi rnams kho na la yod kyi /

analyzed: gong du skyes pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos /

analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skyes pa rnams ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'phags pa ni bsam gtan khyad par dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag tu mi skye'o //

original: de dag gi ni ldan pa'i sgo nas yod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi ni ldan pa'i sgo nas yod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú It exists for them by means of possession‚Äù means

analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams la ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ldan pa'i sgo nas yod kyi mngon sum du gyur pa las ni ma yin te de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: those born in the formless realm possess the uncontaminated vow by means of possession, but it does not exist for them in actuality, because there is no form there.

original: gzhan na ni rang gi ngo bos kyang yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan na ni rang gi ngo bos kyang yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that it exists in other realms by means of its own nature.

original: re zhig dang gtan du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig dang gtan du zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Temporary and permanent‚Äù means

analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba can re zhig sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir bde ba yin te /

analyzed: ji srid du rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba rjes su 'jug pa'i bar du'o // mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ni gtan du ste /

analyzed: srung ba 'am tshim par byed pas na bsod nams so //
translated: It is merit because it protects or satisfies.

original: 'di la rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is investigation and analysis.

translated: Karma to be experienced in a third life and so on is karma that is certain to be experienced in a third life and so on.üîΩKarma to be experienced in a third life and so on is karma that is certain to be experienced in a third life and so on.üîΩKarma to be experienced in a third life and so on is karma that is certain to be experienced in a third life and so on.üîΩKarma to be experienced in a third life and so on is karma that is certain to be experienced in a third life and so on.

original: dper na nyung rum zhig gis rngan pa byin nas glang zhig rlig pa dbyung ba las thar bar byas pa dang / de la mthong ba'i chos kho na la skyes pa'i dbang po byung ngo zhes grag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyung rum zhig gis rngan pa byin nas glang zhig rlig pa dbyung ba las thar bar byas pa dang / de la mthong ba'i chos kho na la skyes pa'i dbang po byung ngo zhes grag pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the story that a eunuch gave a reward to a bull and freed it from castration, and it is said that the faculty of a male arose for him in this very life.

original: yang na der skyes pa'i las de'i sa gang yin yin pa de las gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir las de mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na der skyes pa'i las de'i sa gang yin yin pa de las gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir las de mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, because one is permanently freed from attachment to the level of the karma that produces birth there, that karma is experienced in this life.

original: dper na phyir 'ong ba dang // dgra bcom pa rnams kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs su byas pa lta bu ste sa 'og mar yang mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na phyir 'ong ba dang // dgra bcom pa rnams kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs su byas pa lta bu ste sa 'og mar yang mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like the state of being freed from attachment by once returners and arhats, because they do not return to lower levels.

original: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain nirvana without remainder.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du nges pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du nges pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Karma that is certain to be experienced in another state means

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba 'am lan grangs gzhan la nges par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba 'am lan grangs gzhan la nges par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: karma that is certain to be experienced after rebirth or in another lifetime.

original: de ni de nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sa de nyid du skyes nas sam lan grangs gzhan la'o //üîΩde dang ldan bzhin du gtan @55a * //
analyzed: de ni de nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sa de nyid du skyes nas sam lan grangs gzhan la'o // de dang ldan bzhin du gtan @55a * //
translated: It is said that it ripens in that very life, meaning that it ripens after one is born in that realm or in another life.

original: du 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: du 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is impossible to be completely free from attachment while possessing that karma.

original: gang la gnas skabs gzhan du nges pa'i las yod pa de la ni gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid de /üîΩphyir mi 'ong ba la slar 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: gang la gnas skabs gzhan du nges pa'i las yod pa de la ni gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid de / phyir mi 'ong ba la slar 'ong ba'am /
translated: One for whom karma is certain to be experienced in a specific situation is impossible to be completely free from attachment.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang slar skye ba ni med do ;üîΩ/ de'i phyir las de ni rang gi las gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩma nges pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma nges pa rnam par smin pa 'byin pa la gegs byed pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang slar skye ba ni med do ; / de'i phyir las de ni rang gi las gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i rgyu yin no // ma nges pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma nges pa rnam par smin pa 'byin pa la gegs byed pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: It is impossible for a nonreturner to return to the desire realm or for an arhat to be reborn.üîΩTherefore that karma is the cause of the cessation of complete freedom from attachment to one‚Äôs level.

original: sa de las 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na yin pas 'di ni rnam par mi smin pa yin la /
analyzed: sa de las 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na yin pas 'di ni rnam par mi smin pa yin la /
translated: Karma that is not certain to be experienced is the cause of the cessation of complete freedom from attachment to one‚Äôs level.

original: ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gegs byed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gegs byed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: because it is uncertain, one who is free from attachment to the formless realm is not able to obstruct it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is similar to nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du 'dus byas thams cad 'jug pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du 'dus byas thams cad 'jug pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
translated: Nirvana is the permanent cessation of the process of conditioned states.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa med pas dus ji srid du gcig tu 'gal ba yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa med pas dus ji srid du gcig tu 'gal ba yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Since mind and mental factors do not operate in the state of equipoise in the meditative attainment of cessation, it is similar to nirvana because it is a single state that is incompatible with them for a period of time.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos mngon sum du byas pas phyir de las langs pas sems mchog tu zhi ba thob po //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos mngon sum du byas pas phyir de las langs pas sems mchog tu zhi ba thob po //
translated: Therefore, because one manifests a phenomenon that is similar to nirvana, one obtains the supreme peace of mind when one arises from it.

original: son pa las slar log pa dang 'dra zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par son pa 'dra la /
analyzed: son pa las slar log pa dang 'dra zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par son pa 'dra la /
translated: It is like a person who has gone somewhere and returned.

original: yang langs pa la sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba mya ngan las 'das pa las slar log pa dang 'dra ste //
analyzed: yang langs pa la sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba mya ngan las 'das pa las slar log pa dang 'dra ste //
translated: It is like a person who has gone somewhere and returned.

original: de'i phyir de ni sems mchog tu dang ba'i gzhir gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni sems mchog tu dang ba'i gzhir gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the basis of the most clear mind.

original: phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni phan par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni phan par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The superior intention of benefit is the desire to benefit.

original: phan pa ni 'dir nyon mongs pa ma 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa ni 'dir nyon mongs pa ma 'byung ba'o //
translated: The benefit is the non-arising of the afflictions here.

original: shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu rno ba ste te por gsal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu rno ba ste te por gsal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Very clear means very sharp, that is, very clear.

original: sems can tshad med pa la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the superior intention to benefit immeasurable sentient beings.

original: rgyud ji skad bshad pa'i bsam pa dang rjes 'brel cing mthun par 'brel @55b ba dang / ji skad bshad pa dang pa'i bsod nams kyis yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud ji skad bshad pa'i bsam pa dang rjes 'brel cing mthun par 'brel @55b ba dang / ji skad bshad pa dang pa'i bsod nams kyis yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is related to the mind explained in the scriptures, and it is related to the concordant and compatible. It is related to the permeation by the merit explained in the scriptures.

original: yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bag chags kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bag chags kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: This permeation is a synonym for habit energy.

original: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why is it said that it is related to the superior intention to benefit the immeasurable sentient beings?

original: langs nas dus ha cang yun mi ring ba gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs nas dus ha cang yun mi ring ba gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is held for a long time after arising.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa yin pas dri ma med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa yin pas dri ma med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The transformation of the support is pure because it is new.

original: 'dir gnas yongs su gyur pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gnas yongs su gyur pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the transformation of the support is the attainment of a support that is incompatible with the arising of the passions that are to be eliminated by the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: sar pa smos pa ni langs nas yun ring bo ma lon pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sar pa smos pa ni langs nas yun ring bo ma lon pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúnew‚Äù is used to include those who have not been standing for a long time.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang dgra bcom ba nyid las gsar du langs pa dag ni yon tan sngar ma thob pa thob pas yid bde ba la gzhol ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang dgra bcom ba nyid las gsar du langs pa dag ni yon tan sngar ma thob pa thob pas yid bde ba la gzhol ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who have newly arisen from the path of seeing and the state of an arhat are only intent on mental satisfaction because they have attained qualities that they have not attained previously.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi dbang po shin tu nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi dbang po shin tu nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their faculties are extremely tranquil.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi yid kyi rgyud tha dad pa zil gyis mi gnon pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi yid kyi rgyud tha dad pa zil gyis mi gnon pa ste /
translated: The mental continuum of those who are equipoised in the mundane sphere is not overwhelmed by the different types of objects.

original: rgyu de dag gis gang zag lnga po de dag la phan pa'am gnod par byas pas ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dag gis gang zag lnga po de dag la phan pa'am gnod par byas pas ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of these causes, the five types of persons experience the result in this life if they are benefited or harmed.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because their nature and result are incomplete.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de dag bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa yod pa de ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de dag bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa yod pa de ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can no //
translated: The path of cultivation that is not complete in terms of its nature and result is incomplete in terms of its nature and result.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the path of cultivation?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong gi 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong gi 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i lam ste /
translated: It is the path that produces the result of once-returner and non-returner.

original: de yang slob pa nyid de mi slob pa ma yin pas rang bzhin yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang slob pa nyid de mi slob pa ma yin pas rang bzhin yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is a learner path and not a non-learner path, so it is incomplete in terms of its nature.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu yang yongs su ma rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu yang yongs su ma rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Its result is also incomplete.

original: 'bras bu gnyis dang 'bras bu gcig lhag mar lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis dang 'bras bu gcig lhag mar lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two results and one result remain, respectively.

original: dgra bcom pa thob pa ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa ste bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i lam ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i rang bzhin zad pa @56a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa thob pa ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa ste bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i lam ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i rang bzhin zad pa @56a * //
translated: The path that obtains the state of an arhat is complete in terms of its nature and result, because it is included in the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: shes pas bsdus pa'am bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin te rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas bsdus pa'am bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin te rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the cognition, or it is the nature of the path of cultivation that is complete, because there is no other aspect.

original: de'i phyir lam lhag ma las langs pa ni gnas gyur pa sar pas rgyud yongs su dag pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lam lhag ma las langs pa ni gnas gyur pa sar pas rgyud yongs su dag pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, when one rises from the remaining paths, the continuum is not completely purified by the new transformation.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams las langs pa na lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams las langs pa na lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: How much less so when one rises from the mundane path!

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is non-conceptual means because there is no conceptualization of determination and memory.

original: nags zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i tshogs so //
analyzed: nags zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i tshogs so //
translated: A forest means a collection of grass.

original: ji ltar sems kyi tshor ba rnam par smin pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi tshor ba rnam par smin pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is mental feeling not karmic ripening?

original: gang zhig kho nar de g-yengs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la las rnam par smin pa de ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang tshor ba rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig kho nar de g-yengs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la las rnam par smin pa de ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang tshor ba rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the karmic ripening of the mental consciousness when it is completely distracted, that associated with it is also called the feeling of karmic ripening.

original: ji ltar sems kyi tshor ba mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi tshor ba mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can the feeling of the mind not be the karmic maturation of nonvirtuous karma?

original: de lta na 'di ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par mu bzhi rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'di ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par mu bzhi rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that there are four possibilities,

original: gang gi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang g-yeng ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang g-yeng ba zhes bya la /
translated: because the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral are called distracted.

original: rnam par g-yengs pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na'o //
translated: Distraction is only afflicted.

original: mngon par nyen pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par gnod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par nyen pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par gnod par gyur pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù means ‚Äúafflicted by affliction.‚Äù

original: 'dir kyi hud sems zhes smre sngags 'don pa'i dmyal ba dper bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir kyi hud sems zhes smre sngags 'don pa'i dmyal ba dper bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the example is the hell beings who lament, ‚ÄúAlas, mind!‚Äù

original: rkun po'i sde dpon zhig gis rang sangs rgyas lnga brgya gsod du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: rkun po'i sde dpon zhig gis rang sangs rgyas lnga brgya gsod du bcug pa'o //
translated: This refers to the story of the leader of a band of thieves who killed five hundred solitary realizers.

original: sangs rgyas ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for the Buddha‚Äù refers to the following story.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la ni thugs g-yeng ba dang / rim gyis 'grongs pa dang / gsung 'dzer ba dang / dbu skya ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ste las shin tu dang ba'i rnam par smin pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la ni thugs g-yeng ba dang / rim gyis 'grongs pa dang / gsung 'dzer ba dang / dbu skya ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ste las shin tu dang ba'i rnam par smin pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the Buddhas, there is no distraction of mind, no gradual passing away, no hoarseness of voice, no graying or balding of the head. Because the essence of their karma is extremely pure.

original: ma nges pa ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The indeterminate is because of its maturation.

original: ma nges pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid du gnas so //
translated: The indeterminate is the nature of maturation by the power of the noble path.

original: 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they have transcended the five fears.

original: 'tsho ba dang tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du skrag pa dang / 'chi ba dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du skrag pa dang / 'chi ba dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have transcended the fears of livelihood, of being reproached with unchaste language, of the assembly, of death, and of evil destinies.

original: mi mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mi bsdus pa zhes @56b bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mi bsdus pa zhes @56b bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The unpleasant is the non-inclusion of the afflictions.

original: chos nyid mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos nyid mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: because they have direct knowledge of reality.

original: de la chos nyid 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos nyid 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Reality is that all conditioned things are impermanent,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: all contaminated things are suffering,

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: and all things are empty and insubstantial.

original: de'i phyir de lta na chos kyi rang bzhin mngon par shes pa rnams la mya ngan 'byung ba med do //üîΩg-yo dang zhe sdang 'dod chags skyes //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na chos kyi rang bzhin mngon par shes pa rnams la mya ngan 'byung ba med do // g-yo dang zhe sdang 'dod chags skyes //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the nature of things does not lead to sorrow.üîΩGuile arises from action.

original: las las zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: las las zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the verse is supplied by the words ‚Äúfrom action.‚Äù

original: gya gyu rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gya gyu'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gya gyu rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gya gyu'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from the cause of crookedness, because it is the cause of crookedness.

original: mdo las gya gyu gang zhe na sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes lta ba la gya gyur bshad de /
analyzed: mdo las gya gyu gang zhe na sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes lta ba la gya gyur bshad de /
translated: The sutra explains that crookedness is a view, for it says, ‚ÄúWhat is crookedness? It is a sinful view.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir g-yo las gya gyu zhes brjod do //

original: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis ni de spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang ba'i las spang ngo //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis ni de spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang ba'i las spang ngo //
translated: In this context, the karma that is to be abandoned is that which is motivated by the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the patience for knowing dharmas and the subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
translated: In the freedom from attachment to the desire realm,üîΩthe eight uninterrupted paths abandon the karma that is motivated by the afflictions that are to be abandoned by that path.

original: yang go rims bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad kyis nyon mongs pa ltar des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas bslangs pa'i las spang la de yang gcig tu mi dge ba yin pas nag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang go rims bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad kyis nyon mongs pa ltar des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas bslangs pa'i las spang la de yang gcig tu mi dge ba yin pas nag po zhes bya'o //
translated: That karma is called ‚Äúblack‚Äù because it is nonvirtuous.

original: dkar nag ste dge ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkar nag ste dge ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: White and black karma, that is, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,

original: de ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa las spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa las spangs pa'o //

original: rang gi ngo bo spong pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo spong pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that they abandon their own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo @58b ni thob pa la yongs su bshad pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo @58b ni thob pa la yongs su bshad pa'i ming ngo //
translated: For, their own nature is obtained, and it is explained that they are names.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dgu las de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa de spong bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dgu las de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa de spong bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The abandonment of all the afflictions that have that as their object is established as the abandonment of that, from among the nine uninterrupted paths.

original: rnam pa dgu pa spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of abandoning the ninth type,

original: gzhan rnams ni sngar nyid du spangs zin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni sngar nyid du spangs zin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the others have already been abandoned.

original: 'di las gzhan pa rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other four types,

original: khyad par ni ma bsgribs pa'i las spang ba'i phyir mi bgrang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par ni ma bsgribs pa'i las spang ba'i phyir mi bgrang ngo //
translated: because they are unobscured karma, are not counted.

original: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam bcu bdun gyis bsdus pa ni las rnam pa gsum gyis las rnams spang pa'i phyir 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam bcu bdun gyis bsdus pa ni las rnam pa gsum gyis las rnams spang pa'i phyir 'jug go //
translated: In the same way, the seventeen uninterrupted paths are engaged for the sake of abandoning the three types of karma.

original: 'dod gzhan myong 'gyur gnyis su rig / ces bya ba la 'di yang sngar nyid du bzlog zin to //
analyzed: 'dod gzhan myong 'gyur gnyis su rig / ces bya ba la 'di yang sngar nyid du bzlog zin to //
translated: Karma to be experienced in the desire realm and in other rebirths should be understood as two.

original: mi dge ba ni dkar nag tu rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni dkar nag tu rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Nonvirtue is not white or black.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: bishkri ta t'at ces zer ro //
analyzed: bishkri ta t'at ces zer ro //
translated: It is vi≈õi·π£·π≠a, ‚Äúdistinguished.‚Äù

original: 'dir re re dkar nag nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir re re dkar nag nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not asserted that each is white or black.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sa mu di ta yod:zhes 'di dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sa mu di ta yod:zhes 'di dpyad par bya'o //
translated: It should be analyzed whether samudita, ‚Äúcombined,‚Äù is present.

original: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar nag ces bya ba 'di yang mi rung ngo zhes de nyid smra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar nag ces bya ba 'di yang mi rung ngo zhes de nyid smra'o //
translated: He says that it is not correct to say that what is derived from the desire realm is white and black.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dir rnam par smin pa ma yin yang 'dir las rnam par yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dir rnam par smin pa ma yin yang 'dir las rnam par yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Though what is to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation is not karmic maturation, it is karma here.

original: gang rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa de nyid gzung bas rnam par smin pa nag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa de nyid gzung bas rnam par smin pa nag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is karmic maturation is black karmic maturation‚Äù and so on, it is taken as karmic maturation.

original: de lta na yang stobs dang ldan pas nyam chung ba zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir mi dge ba ni dkar nag nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang stobs dang ldan pas nyam chung ba zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir mi dge ba ni dkar nag nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Even so, it is not tenable that nonvirtue is white and black because the powerful overpowers the weak.

original: thub pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thub pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Muni is threefold.

original: thub ba'i dngos po thub pa yin pa dang 'di thub pa'i yin pa ni thub pa'i 'o //
analyzed: thub ba'i dngos po thub pa yin pa dang 'di thub pa'i yin pa ni thub pa'i 'o //
translated: The Muni is the one who has the nature of being a Muni, and the Muni's are those who have the Muni.

original: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Muni's are the unlearned states of bodily and verbal karma.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho na yin gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin te mi slob pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho na yin gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin te mi slob pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are only non-indicative form, because they are called the unlearned states.

original: sems pa ni don dam par thub pa yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems pa ni don dam par thub pa yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The intention is the ultimate Muni.

original: de rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it is the primary cause of purification.

original: thub pa nyid thub pa yin te /
analyzed: thub pa nyid thub pa yin te /
translated: Munihood is the Muni.

original: rang gi don la 'phel ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rang gi don la 'phel ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it is the accomplishment of the increase of one's own aim.

original: de ni lus dang dag gi sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thub pa zhes bya bar te /
analyzed: de ni lus dang dag gi sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thub pa zhes bya bar te /
translated: It is to be inferred through the body and speech.

original: @59a * // de'i phyir gang gis dang gang rjes su dpag pa de dag kho na thub pa'i yin par bshad kyi yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @59a * // de'i phyir gang gis dang gang rjes su dpag pa de dag kho na thub pa'i yin par bshad kyi yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Muni is explained as those by whom and those for whom there is inference, but not the mental karma.

original: de ltar na mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni 'di yin pas thub pa'o zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar na mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni 'di yin pas thub pa'o zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: Thus, the body and speech of the nonlearner are established as the Muni, the Sage.

original: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
translated: But not the mind.

original: gal te mi slob pa'i sems pa yang yid kyi ltar de dag gi rdzas su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na rjes su dpag mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te mi slob pa'i sems pa yang yid kyi ltar de dag gi rdzas su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na rjes su dpag mod kyi /
translated: If you say that the volition of the nonlearner is not to be inferred as a substance like the mind, we reply:

original: de ni sems la brten pas de las sems nyid gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems la brten pas de las sems nyid gtso bo yin no //
translated: It is inferred, but since it is based on the mind, the mind itself is primary.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon bdag nyid kyis gzhung lugs 'chad pa'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon bdag nyid kyis gzhung lugs 'chad pa'o /
translated: Moreover, the master himself explains the system.

original: spang ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /
translated: The nature of abandonment is the nature of noninformative form.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Thus, attention is not the nature of informative form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / sems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why?üîΩBecause the mind does not have noninformative form.

original: 'di ltar sems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the mind does not have noninformative form.

original: thub pa yang spong ba'i don gyis yin te zhes bya ba ni spong ba ni gcod pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa yang spong ba'i don gyis yin te zhes bya ba ni spong ba ni gcod pa ste /
translated: And also because he is a sage in the sense of abandoning, i.e., cutting off, all that is unwholesome.

original: mi dge ba thams cad spang ba'i don gyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mi dge ba thams cad spang ba'i don gyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that he is a sage in the sense of abandoning all that is unwholesome.

original: nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa thams cad med pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa thams cad med pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because he is devoid of all the expressions of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni log pa la dmigs pa'i phyir brjod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni log pa la dmigs pa'i phyir brjod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The afflictions are called expressions because they are the objects of error.

original: brjod pa dang rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa dang rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Expression and conceptualization are not different in meaning.

original: slob dpon pa ni nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa yod pas don dam par thub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon pa ni nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa yod pas don dam par thub pa ma yin te /
translated: The Master is not a sage ultimately because he has the expressions of the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir slob pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid ni thub par rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid ni thub par rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the body, speech, and mind of the learner are not established as a sage.

original: thub pa'i ni gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnyis kyi sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //üîΩgtsang byed gsum zhes byed pa la /
analyzed: thub pa'i ni gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnyis kyi sgo nas rnam par gzhag go // gtsang byed gsum zhes byed pa la /
translated: The sage is established by means of the two aggregates of form and consciousness.üîΩThe three purifiers.

original: gtsang ba'i dngos po ni gtsang byed do //
analyzed: gtsang ba'i dngos po ni gtsang byed do //
translated: The thing that purifies is the purifier.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: re zhig zag pa med pa ni gtsang byed ces bya bar rigs na /
analyzed: re zhig zag pa med pa ni gtsang byed ces bya bar rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable to say that the uncontaminated is purifying,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa mi gtsang bas sun phyung ba gtsang byed ces bya ba ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa mi gtsang bas sun phyung ba gtsang byed ces bya ba ji ltar 'thob ce na /
translated: but how can the contaminated, which is defiled by the impurity of the afflictions, be called purifying?

original: de'i phyir dus re zhig dang gzhan du nyes par spyod pa nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus re zhig dang gzhan du nyes par spyod pa nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it temporarily and ultimately eliminates the stain of misconduct, the afflictions.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pas @59b ni re zhig tu'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pas @59b ni re zhig tu'o //
translated: The contaminated is purifying temporarily,

original: gtan pa med pas ni gtan du'o //
analyzed: gtan pa med pas ni gtan du'o //
translated: and the uncontaminated is purifying ultimately.

original: de'i phyir dus re zhig tu nyes par spyad pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa don dam pa'i gtsang byed 'dren par byed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pas kyang gtsang byed ces bya ba 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus re zhig tu nyes par spyad pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa don dam pa'i gtsang byed 'dren par byed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pas kyang gtsang byed ces bya ba 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, the contaminated is also called purifying because it temporarily eliminates the stain of misconduct and because it induces the ultimate purifying of the uncontaminated.

original: log par thub pa dang gtsang spra la mos pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: log par thub pa dang gtsang spra la mos pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are devoted to false asceticism and purity

original: gang dag mi smra ba dang / phyi rol gyi dri ma spangs pas mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob po zhes zhes bya ba de ltar lta ba de dag ni log pa'i thub pa dang / gtsang spra la mos pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag mi smra ba dang / phyi rol gyi dri ma spangs pas mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob po zhes zhes bya ba de ltar lta ba de dag ni log pa'i thub pa dang / gtsang spra la mos pa'o //
translated: Those who say that one attains high status and liberation by not speaking and by abandoning external stains have a wrong view of purity.

original: dgar ba ni lta ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dgar ba ni lta ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are devoted to a wrong teacher and purity.

original: lus kyi las sogs pa mi dge ba /
analyzed: lus kyi las sogs pa mi dge ba /
translated: Nonvirtuous karma of body and so on

original: nyes par spyad pa gsum du 'dod /
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa gsum du 'dod /
translated: are asserted to be the three misdeeds.

original: lus dang ngag gis las mi dge ba sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug ces bya ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems gang cung zad cig yin pa de ni go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag gi dang / yid gnyis kyis nyes par spyad pa yin no /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gis las mi dge ba sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug ces bya ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems gang cung zad cig yin pa de ni go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag gi dang / yid gnyis kyis nyes par spyad pa yin no /
translated: Nonvirtuous karma of body and speech and the preparation, actual action and conclusion of nonvirtuous karma and any nonvirtuous mind are misdeeds of body, speech and both or mental misdeeds respectively.

original: ched du bsam pa bya ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ched du bsam pa bya ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Sutra on Intentional Action declares:

original: dge slong dag ji ltar ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas shing bsags pa yin zhe na dge slong dag 'di na la la ched du bsams nas lus kyis las rnam pa gsum byed cing bsags pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas shing bsags pa yin zhe na dge slong dag 'di na la la ched du bsams nas lus kyis las rnam pa gsum byed cing bsags pa yin la /
translated: Monks, how is it that intentional karma is created and accumulated? Monks, here someone creates and accumulates three types of karma with the body,

original: ngag gi rnam pa bzhi dang yid kyis rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ngag gi rnam pa bzhi dang yid kyis rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: four types with speech, and three types with the mind.

original: dge slong dag ji ltar yid kyis ched du bsam par bya ba'i las rnam pa gsum byas shing bsags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar yid kyis ched du bsam par bya ba'i las rnam pa gsum byas shing bsags pa yin zhe na /
translated: Monks, how is it that intentional karma is created and accumulated with the mind?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'di nas dge slong la la brnab sems dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: 'di nas dge slong la la brnab sems dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Here a monk has covetousness,

original: gnod sems can gyi sems su gyur pa yin /
analyzed: gnod sems can gyi sems su gyur pa yin /
translated: has a mind of ill will,

original: log par lta ba zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: and has wrong views.

original: dpes ston pa rnams na re /üîΩbrnab sems la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi las gzhan ma bshad de /
analyzed: dpes ston pa rnams na re / brnab sems la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi las gzhan ma bshad de /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:üîΩKarma other than covetousness and so on is not explained as mental karma because it is not intentional.

original: de'i phyir brnab sems la sogs pa dag kho na yid kyi las yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir brnab sems la sogs pa dag kho na yid kyi las yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore covetousness and so on are mental karma.

original: de lta na ni las dang nyon mongs pa dag gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni las dang nyon mongs pa dag gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, karma and affliction would be the same.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: mdo las gsum gyi rgyu dang kun 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mdo las gsum gyi rgyu dang kun 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Because it is said in the sutras that they are the three causes and origins.üîΩWhat would happen?

original: ci 'byung zhes bya ba ni nyes pa ci @60a * //üîΩ'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci 'byung zhes bya ba ni nyes pa ci @60a * // 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What fault would there be?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it contradicts the sutras,

original: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says karma is intention and what is intended.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa las ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa las ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore it is certain that karma does not arise from affliction.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa las nyid du mi 'dod na de lta ched du bsam par bya ba'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa las nyid du mi 'dod na de lta ched du bsam par bya ba'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you do not assert that karma arises from affliction, then that contradicts the sutra that states:

original: mdo las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The sutra says:

original: de'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba'i brnab sems la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems pa zhugs pa de'i phyir brnab sems la sogs pa de dag gis sems pa der ston par byed de ;
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba'i brnab sems la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems pa zhugs pa de'i phyir brnab sems la sogs pa de dag gis sems pa der ston par byed de ;
translated: Because of that, i.e., because of covetousness, etc., the mind is engaged. Therefore, those covetousness, etc., are indicated by that engagement of the mind.

original: gzhan du na mdo dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mdo dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be a contradiction with the sutra.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re yid kyi las kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir de dag la 'di skad du bsnyad de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re yid kyi las kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir de dag la 'di skad du bsnyad de /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: They are called mental actions because they are a collection of mental actions.
