original: de lta na 'o na las kyi lam thams cad kyang nges par gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir gti mug kho nas rdzogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na las kyi lam thams cad kyang nges par gti mug dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir gti mug kho nas rdzogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that all karmic paths are definitely completed by delusion alone because they arise simultaneously with delusion.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dag gi der gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dag gi der gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because attachment and aversion are primary in that context.

original: de bzhin du log par lta ba yang gti mug gis yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du log par lta ba yang gti mug gis yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, wrong view is not completed by delusion alone,

original: der de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because delusion is primary in that context.

original: gtso bo nyid de las gzhan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo nyid de las gzhan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: It is primary because roots of virtue exist other than that.

original: log par lta ba dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid ma yin @64a * //
analyzed: log par lta ba dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid ma yin @64a * //
translated: Wrong view is not itself a root of virtue.

original: no ; /'o na brnab sems la sogs pa gti mug gis mthar phyin par mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: no ; /'o na brnab sems la sogs pa gti mug gis mthar phyin par mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it is not tenable that covetousness and so on are completed by delusion.

original: de dag mi dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gti mug der gti mug gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mi dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gti mug der gti mug gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the roots of nonvirtue, and because delusion is not the principal element in them.

original: mthar phyin pa'i don ni der gtso bo yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i don ni der gtso bo yin pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcompletion‚Äù is that delusion is the principal element in them.

original: de ltar na 'dir skyon med do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir skyon med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault in our interpretation.

original: cha bzhir bshad pa zhes bya ba ni tshad bzhir ro //
analyzed: cha bzhir bshad pa zhes bya ba ni tshad bzhir ro //
translated: The four parts are the four measures.

original: thun mong du srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni zhe sdang gis mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: thun mong du srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni zhe sdang gis mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: In common, killing, etc., are completed by hatred.

original: tshan gcig dang 'dra bar gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshan gcig dang 'dra bar gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the other three roots of nonvirtue.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ni sems can yin no zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa las las kyi lam de skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ni sems can yin no zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa las las kyi lam de skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: The basis of killing, etc., is a sentient being, because the karmic path arises from a collection of the aggregates.

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa dag las ni skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa dag las ni skye ba mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for it to arise from non-sentient beings.

original: gal te de dag gi rten ni ming dang gzugs kyang yin par rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gi rten ni ming dang gzugs kyang yin par rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt name-and-form also the basis of those karmic paths?

original: phung po tshogs pa kho na la bltos nas gsod pa la sogs pa dag 'byung gi /
analyzed: phung po tshogs pa kho na la bltos nas gsod pa la sogs pa dag 'byung gi /
translated: Killing, etc., occur in dependence on a collection of aggregates.

original: phung po'i phyogs gcig la bltos nas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: phung po'i phyogs gcig la bltos nas ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not in relation to a part of the aggregates.

original: phung po gcig dang skad cig ma la yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po gcig dang skad cig ma la yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Name-and-form is not in relation to one aggregate or one moment.

original: phung po skad cig dang skad cig ma gcig la ni gsod pa la sogs pa dag 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: phung po skad cig dang skad cig ma gcig la ni gsod pa la sogs pa dag 'jug pa med do //
translated: In one moment of one aggregate, there is no killing, etc.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi rten ming dang gzugs yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi rten ming dang gzugs yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not accepted that name-and-form is the basis of those.

original: gzhan gyi bud med kyi gan du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gzhi ni longs spyod yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med kyi gan du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gzhi ni longs spyod yin no //
translated: The basis of going to another‚Äôs wife, etc. is enjoyment.

original: longs spyod la brten nas las kyi lam 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod la brten nas las kyi lam 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the path of action arises in dependence on enjoyment.

original: sems can gzhan gyi longs spyod rang bzhin longs spyod du nye bar snyon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi longs spyod rang bzhin longs spyod du nye bar snyon par byed pa'o //
translated: One seizes the enjoyment of another being as one‚Äôs own enjoyment.

original: las kyi lam 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba des na /
analyzed: las kyi lam 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba des na /
translated: Because it becomes the cause for the arising of the path of action.

original: gzhan gyi bud med kyi gan du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gzhi ni longs spyod yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med kyi gan du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gzhi ni longs spyod yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the basis of going to another‚Äôs wife, etc. is enjoyment.

original: gzhi sems can ma yin yang rung ste yongs su longs spyod pa'i thabs la ni sems can rnams las kyi lam 'byung bas de dag longs spyod kyi gzhi nyid du brtag go //
analyzed: gzhi sems can ma yin yang rung ste yongs su longs spyod pa'i thabs la ni sems can rnams las kyi lam 'byung bas de dag longs spyod kyi gzhi nyid du brtag go //
translated: Even though sentient beings are not the basis of enjoyment, they are considered to be the basis of enjoyment because the karmic paths arise in sentient beings as the means of enjoyment.

original: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni ming dang gzugs yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni ming dang gzugs yin te /
translated: The basis of wrong view is name-and-form.

original: ming gi dbang du byas nas de la skur pa 'debs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming gi dbang du byas nas de la skur pa 'debs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages in denial in terms of name.

original: de'i sbyor bas 'chi ba'i @64b phyir dang de'i tshe lus gzhan skyes pa'i phyir the tshom za bas /
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas 'chi ba'i @64b phyir dang de'i tshe lus gzhan skyes pa'i phyir the tshom za bas /
translated: Because it is uncertain whether or not it is the basis of the karmic path of killing, since one may die through the application of that poison and one may be born in another body at that time.

original: gang zhig gis pha rol 'chi bar nges par byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
analyzed: gang zhig gis pha rol 'chi bar nges par byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
translated: Therefore it is asked: ‚ÄúBy whom is the other definitely killed?‚Äù

original: dngos med ces bya ba ni dngos sngon du 'gro bas mjug kyang med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med ces bya ba ni dngos sngon du 'gro bas mjug kyang med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúnonentity‚Äù indicates that since an entity precedes it, the conclusion is also nonentity.

original: lus gzhan skyes phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gang la gnas pas de'i sbyor ba byas pa de kho na de'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa las kyi lam du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lus gzhan skyes phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gang la gnas pas de'i sbyor ba byas pa de kho na de'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa las kyi lam du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because another body is born means that the karmic path is completed by the result of that very body in which one engages in the application of that poison.

original: ris mthun tha dad pa'i lus la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ris mthun tha dad pa'i lus la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not in bodies of the same type.

original: de sbyor ba po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sbyor ba po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the body of the same class, because that is not the agent.

original: don gyis phan tshun du sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi sbyor bas byed pa po ma yin kyang /
analyzed: don gyis phan tshun du sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi sbyor bas byed pa po ma yin kyang /
translated: The meaning is that they are mutually related as the agent and object, even though they are not so related by way of verbal expression.üîΩKilling is the intentional, non-erroneous, killing of another.

original: srog gcod pa ni bsams bzhin du ma nor bar ni gzhan gsod pa'o zhes bya ba la srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩbsams bzhin pa dang bsam bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ni bsams bzhin du ma nor bar ni gzhan gsod pa'o zhes bya ba la srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / bsams bzhin pa dang bsam bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Killing is of two kinds: intentional and unintentional.

original: bsams bzhin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te nor pa dang ma nor pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te nor pa dang ma nor pa'o //
translated: Intentional killing is of two kinds: erroneous and non-erroneous.

original: ma nor pa de la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ma nor pa de la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Non-erroneous killing is of two kinds:

original: bdag dang gzhan gsod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gsod pa ste /
translated: killing another and killing oneself.

original: de'i phyir rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir khyad par rnam pa gsum brtsams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir khyad par rnam pa gsum brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, three kinds of distinctions are made in order to eliminate the doubt that one might kill oneself or kill another by mistake.

original: yang ci'i phyir ma bsams pa nor ba dang / bdag srog gcod pa mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir ma bsams pa nor ba dang / bdag srog gcod pa mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it that unintentional killing and killing oneself are not considered killing?

original: sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag bdag gi rten sa na mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag bdag gi rten sa na mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the application is impossible and because merit and demerit are impossible as the basis of the self.

original: de ltar bshad dang / gal te srog chags gzhan yin pa dang / 'di gsad par bya'o zhes de la sbyor ba byas pa dang gang la sbyor ba byas pa de nyid gsod par byed kyi gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad dang / gal te srog chags gzhan yin pa dang / 'di gsad par bya'o zhes de la sbyor ba byas pa dang gang la sbyor ba byas pa de nyid gsod par byed kyi gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If another living being is killed and the one who applies himself to killing that being kills that very being and not another,

original: de lta na de las srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de las srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: then he is touched by the offense of killing that being and not by the offense of killing another.

original: des na 'dor ba'i sems su byas pa ni gang la sbyor ba byas pa dang / gang la the tshom na bde gnyis ka des yongs su dor ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dor ba'i sems su byas pa ni gang la sbyor ba byas pa dang / gang la the tshom na bde gnyis ka des yongs su dor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when he has the intention to abandon, he abandons both the one to whom he applies himself and the one about whom he is uncertain.

original: ji ltar phung po skad cig bdag la srog gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar phung po skad cig bdag la srog gcod par 'gyur /
translated: How can there be killing of a self that is momentary aggregates?

original: ji lta mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta mi 'gyur /
translated: How can there not be?

original: 'di ltar phung po skad cig ma da ltar ba ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor bas mi gsod de //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po skad cig ma da ltar ba ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor bas mi gsod de //
translated: The present moment of the momentary aggregates does not kill by the application of killing.

original: rang nyid 'jig pa la mngon du @65a * //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jig pa la mngon du @65a * //
translated: And they are headed for their own destruction.

original: phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is about to be destroyed.

original: de lta ma yin na yang skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the destruction of the moment would be impeded.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the future,

original: gsad par mi nus pa'i phyir /üîΩbdag med na gsad par bya ba med pa'i phyir yang srog gcod pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsad par mi nus pa'i phyir / bdag med na gsad par bya ba med pa'i phyir yang srog gcod pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: because it cannot be killed.üîΩAnd because it is impossible to kill when there is no self,

original: bdag bsad pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag bsad pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that killing occurs because the self is killed.

original: da ltar ba'i phung po 'gags pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i phung po 'gags pas srog gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that killing occurs because the present aggregates are destroyed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: srog ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called life force is explained in detail.

original: ji ltar rlung sems la brten ce ne /
analyzed: ji ltar rlung sems la brten ce ne /
translated: How is the life force dependent on the wind and mind?

original: sems la rag las 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems la rag las 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it functions in dependence on the mind,

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang shi ba la mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang shi ba la mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur when one enters the meditative absorption of cessation or the meditative absorption of nonperception, or when one dies.

original: de gcod par byed do byed pa ni /
analyzed: de gcod par byed do byed pa ni /
translated: It is cut off by that.

original: de'i rgyun dang 'gal ba'i phyir gcod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyun dang 'gal ba'i phyir gcod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it interrupts the continuum of that life, it is killing.

original: 'di ltar srog gi mtshan nyid ma 'ongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar skyob par srog gi skad cig da ltar ba 'gags pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar srog gi mtshan nyid ma 'ongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar skyob par srog gi skad cig da ltar ba 'gags pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the present moment of life that is about to cease is a condition that protects the future life that is incompatible with the characteristics of life.

original: srog gi skad cig ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can skye ba la rgyur mi 'gyur bas rgyun 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: srog gi skad cig ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can skye ba la rgyur mi 'gyur bas rgyun 'chad par 'gyur la /
translated: The future moment of life that possesses the attribute of arising does not become the cause of arising, and so the continuum is severed.

original: de skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rkyen sgrub par byed pa po yang srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rkyen sgrub par byed pa po yang srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the agent who establishes the conditions for its arising and cessation is also touched by the misdeed of killing.

original: dper na mar me'am dril bu'i skad 'gag par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na mar me'am dril bu'i skad 'gag par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the cessation of a lamp or the sound of a bell.

original: mar me'i skad cig ma da ltar ba 'gags pas mar me 'gag par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me'i skad cig ma da ltar ba 'gags pas mar me 'gag par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The present moment of a lamp does not cause the cessation of a lamp because it is about to cease.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa la skye ba'i gegs byed pas yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa la skye ba'i gegs byed pas yin te /
translated: It is because it obstructs the arising of the future moment of life that is asserted to arise.

original: dril bu'i skad dang / srog gi dbang po la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dril bu'i skad dang / srog gi dbang po la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the sound of a bell and the faculty of life force.

original: srog de gang gis yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srog de gang gis yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the life force of?

original: srog de bdag gi yin yid dang 'brel bas de nyid gson no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: srog de bdag gi yin yid dang 'brel bas de nyid gson no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The life force is the self‚Äôs, because it is related to the mind.

original: de med na srog de gang gis yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la son zhes bya'i bdag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de med na srog de gang gis yin zhes bya ba'o // de'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la son zhes bya'i bdag ni ma yin te /
translated: If it does not exist, what is the life force of?üîΩTherefore, the body that possesses faculties is said to be alive, but not the self.

original: de'i phyir srog gi dbang po ni de'i yin gyi bdag gi ni ma @65b yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog gi dbang po ni de'i yin gyi bdag gi ni ma @65b yin no //
translated: Therefore, the life force belongs to that, but not to the self.

original: blo snga nas btang ba'i srog bcad pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: blo snga nas btang ba'i srog bcad pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The sutra says, ‚ÄúIf one kills a living being with prior thought and prior intention, one commits an unvirtuous act.‚Äù

original: kyang zhes pa'i sgra ni blo sngar btang btang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes pa'i sgra ni blo sngar btang btang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not only when one has prior thought.

original: dper na me dang reg pa las tshig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na me dang reg pa las tshig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, one is burned by fire and contact.

original: blo sngar btang ngam ma btang yang bla ste /
analyzed: blo sngar btang ngam ma btang yang bla ste /
translated: Whether one has prior thought or not,

original: reg pa rnams 'tshig ste /
analyzed: reg pa rnams 'tshig ste /
translated: one is burned by contact.

original: de'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of that.

original: srog chags gsod pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: srog chags gsod pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to killing living beings.

original: de dag gi ltar na gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg pa la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg pa la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: According to them, it would follow that seeing and touching another‚Äôs wife would be unrighteous.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg nas 'dod chags can rnams la chos ma yin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan pha dang bu la sogs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba blo sngar ma btang ba rnams la yang chos ma yin par 'gyur ro
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi chung ma mthong ba dang reg nas 'dod chags can rnams la chos ma yin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan pha dang bu la sogs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba blo sngar ma btang ba rnams la yang chos ma yin par 'gyur ro
translated: Just as seeing and touching another‚Äôs wife is unrighteous for those who are lustful, so it would be unrighteous for those who are free from lust, if they do not first give up their thoughts of their father, son, and so on.

original: // de gcer bur skra 'bal ba dang khros pa na bsod nams 'dod pa yang chos ma yin pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // de gcer bur skra 'bal ba dang khros pa na bsod nams 'dod pa yang chos ma yin pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who desires merit sees a naked ascetic with disheveled hair and angry, he would be connected with unrighteousness.

original: dka' thub drag po'i lung 'bogs pa na don ma yin pa 'dod pa ltar de la phan pa 'dogs pa'i ston pa'am /
analyzed: dka' thub drag po'i lung 'bogs pa na don ma yin pa 'dod pa ltar de la phan pa 'dogs pa'i ston pa'am /
translated: If one who desires an evil goal hears the teaching of severe asceticism, the teacher who benefits him would be connected with evil.

original: gzhan yang sdig pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdig pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: And others would be connected with evil.

original: de dag gsung de shi na zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa gsung de shin de la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'i zas sbyin par byed pa ltar /
analyzed: de dag gsung de shi na zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa gsung de shin de la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'i zas sbyin par byed pa ltar /
translated: If you say that the father and so on are not immoral because they do not intend to harm, then why is the one who gives poisoned food to the Nirgrantha not immoral?

translated: It is the desire for others‚Äô wealth by improper means.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa las log par mi rigs pa zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩde 'jig rten na brnab sems spangs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa las log par mi rigs pa zhes bya ba smos so // de 'jig rten na brnab sems spangs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the commentary states, ‚Äúby improper means.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa spangs te zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa spangs te zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di ga las she na /
translated: The avoidance of covetousness is the avoidance of desire for others‚Äô wealth.

original: de nyid kyi mjug thogs su gnod sems la sogs pa spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir te /üîΩde 'jig rten na brnab sems spangs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mjug thogs su gnod sems la sogs pa spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir te /üîΩde 'jig rten na brnab sems spangs te /
translated: The avoidance of malice is the avoidance of desire to harm others.üîΩThe avoidance of wrong views is the avoidance of the view that there is no giving, no offering, no sacrifice, no good or bad deeds, no result of good or bad deeds, no this world or the next, no mother or father, no ascetics or brahmans who have attained the threefold knowledge and who, having realized this world and the next, make their declarations.

original: brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas shing 'jig rten na gnod sems dang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom spangs te dogs pa las brgal zhing the tshom las brgal nas chos dge ba rnams la nem nur med
analyzed: brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas shing 'jig rten na gnod sems dang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom spangs te dogs pa las brgal zhing the tshom las brgal nas chos dge ba rnams la nem nur med
translated: One who abides with a mind free of covetousness, who abandons malice and harmfulness in the world, who abandons lethargy and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt, who has gone beyond doubt, who has no hesitation regarding virtuous qualities,

original: par gyur pa yin /
analyzed: par gyur pa yin /
translated: has abandoned the five obscurations.

original: de sgrib pa lnga spangs nas zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pa'i de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa thams cad brnab sems yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de sgrib pa lnga spangs nas zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pa'i de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa thams cad brnab sems yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Since it is said that one who has abandoned the five obscurations has abandoned all craving that occurs in the desire realm, we understand that all craving that occurs in the desire realm is covetousness.

original: las dang 'bras bu dang 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa 'di ril gyis log par lta ba yin no zhes bya pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa 'di ril gyis log par lta ba yin no zhes bya pa 'byung ste /
translated: The entire denial of action, effect, and ƒÅryas is wrong view.

original: de la sbyin pa med do mchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa med do mchod sbyin med do //
translated: The denial of generosity, sacrifice,

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: burnt offerings,

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: good conduct,

original: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni las la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni las la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: and bad conduct is the denial of action.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu @70a * //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu @70a * //
translated: There is no result of good or bad actions.

original: rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There is no ripening of karma.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: There is no this world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: There is no other world.üîΩThere are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally.

original: sems can brdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can brdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: This is a denial of the effect.

original: yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gang yang rung ba la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir gnyi ga la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gang yang rung ba la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir gnyi ga la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because it denies either the cause or the effect, it is a denial of both.üîΩThere are no ascetics or brahmins who are arhats.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze dang dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze dang dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
translated: This is a denial of the noble ones.

original: de dag gi rgyu bas rgyu ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu bas rgyu ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of these is the cause of their movement.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa go rims bzhin du chags pa dang mi mthun pa dang / log pa'i nges par rtog pa'i rnam pa can de dag gi dbang gis de dag dang mthun par sems pas sems par byed cing mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa go rims bzhin du chags pa dang mi mthun pa dang / log pa'i nges par rtog pa'i rnam pa can de dag gi dbang gis de dag dang mthun par sems pas sems par byed cing mngon par 'du byed de /

original: de'i phyir de dag gi rgyu bas rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi rgyu bas rgyu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúthose who move by means of that.

original: de dag gi 'gros kyis 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi 'gros kyis 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: phyi ma snga ma'i bshad pa yin par dgongs te smos pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma snga ma'i bshad pa yin par dgongs te smos pa'o //
translated: The latter is the explanation of the former.

original: las dang lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las dang lam zhes bya ba la /

original: sems pa zhes bya ba ni las min no zhes bya ba ni las yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa zhes bya ba ni las min no zhes bya ba ni las yin no zhes bya ba'o //

original: de dag kun nas slong ba'i sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag kun nas slong ba'i sems pa zhes bya ba ni /

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa de dag sems pa gang gis kun nas slong ba ste 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa de dag sems pa gang gis kun nas slong ba ste 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de dag la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they engage in action in dependence on them.

original: de dag la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage in action by objectifying them.

original: las kyi lam dang zhes bya ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: las kyi lam dang zhes bya ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The karmic path is covetousness and so on.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun ni lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir las dang las kyi lam yang yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun ni lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir las dang las kyi lam yang yin no //
translated: The seven such as killing are both karma and karmic paths because they are by nature body and speech.

original: de dag kun nas slong ba'i sems pa ni de dag la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kun nas slong ba'i sems pa ni de dag la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention that instigates them is the basis for engaging in them.

original: mi 'dra ba rnams la yang gcig yin par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba rnams la yang gcig yin par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is established that they are one in the case of dissimilar actions.

original: gang mi mngon pa ni yon tan no zhes bya ba 'di ltar de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang mi mngon pa ni yon tan no zhes bya ba 'di ltar de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: The qualities are not manifest, but they are said to be the root of those actions.

original: sbyor ba 'jug pa ni dngos kyi las kyi lam gyi don du'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'jug pa ni dngos kyi las kyi lam gyi don du'o //

original: mjug 'jug @70b pa ni las kyi lam gyi rtsa ba can yin no //
analyzed: mjug 'jug @70b pa ni las kyi lam gyi rtsa ba can yin no //
translated: The engagement of conclusion is the root of the karmic path.

original: las kyi lam yang las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba dang mjug tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi lam yang las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba dang mjug tu 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: de ni dngos gzhi kho na yin gyi las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba dang mjug ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos gzhi kho na yin gyi las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba dang mjug ma yin no //
translated: That is the actual basis alone, but it is not preparation and conclusion for the karmic path.

original: 'jig rten na gang dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba ste ;
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba ste ;
translated: The world says that those who are not satisfied with their own wivesüîΩand who engage in sexual union with the wives of others are not satisfied.

original: de ltar yang thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang / rnam smin 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod /
analyzed: de ltar yang thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang / rnam smin 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod /
translated: It is asserted that all are results of the dominant result, result of natural outflow and result of karmic maturation.

original: phyi nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: yang na gcig gis 'dren pas na zhes bya ba ni brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: yang na gcig gis 'dren pas na zhes bya ba ni brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba 'dren par byed do //
translated: Or, they are called ‚Äúcourses‚Äù because one is led by them.

original: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other courses of action.

original: de ltar na de dag ni yid kyi las yin pas las kyang yin la lam yang yin pas las kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni yid kyi las yin pas las kyang yin la lam yang yin pas las kyi lam yin no //
translated: Thus, they are courses of action because they are both action and courses of action, since they are mental actions.

original: kun tu spyod pa dang 'gal ba yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa dang 'gal ba yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are incompatible with the practice of virtue,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag cig car kun tu spyod pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi log par lta ba bzhin du ldan pa dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //üîΩchen po yongs su rdzogs pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag cig car kun tu spyod pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi log par lta ba bzhin du ldan pa dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // chen po yongs su rdzogs pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because one does not practice virtue and nonvirtue simultaneously, but they are not incompatible with possession, as is false view.üîΩThey are completed by the accomplishment of the great.

original: chen po nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: chen po nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The great is completed by the great.

original: chen po'i chen pos zhes bya ba don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i chen pos zhes bya ba don gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthe great of the great.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: chen pos yongs su rdzogs pas kyang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chen pos yongs su rdzogs pas kyang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: They are also completed by the great.

original: bi pra ti pa ra la sogs pas ma bcom pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bi pra ti pa ra la sogs pas ma bcom pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is perfect because it is not destroyed by viparyƒÅsa, pratyƒÅsa, etc.

original: log par lta ba mi dge ba'i rtsa bas drangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: log par lta ba mi dge ba'i rtsa bas drangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because wrong view is drawn out by the root of demerit.

original: de'i mjug gis de bskyed pa'i phyir dang de'i stobs kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa bas drangs pas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i mjug gis de bskyed pa'i phyir dang de'i stobs kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa bas drangs pas zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is drawn out by the root of demerit, it is said that it is drawn out by the root of demerit because it is generated by its conclusion and because the root of demerit severs the root of merit by its power.

original: mi dge'i rtsa ba chen pos drangs pa'i log par lta bas dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i las kyang de 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kho na la brten pas bstan bcos dang 'gal pa med do //
analyzed: mi dge'i rtsa ba chen pos drangs pa'i log par lta bas dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i las kyang de 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kho na la brten pas bstan bcos dang 'gal pa med do //
translated: Because the function of severing the root of merit by wrong view drawn out by the great root of demerit also draws it out, it is taught that it is based only on the roots of demerit. Therefore there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The roots of merit are of six kinds.

original: khams gsum po re re la skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor ba las byung ba yod pas @71a * //
analyzed: khams gsum po re re la skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor ba las byung ba yod pas @71a * //
translated: Because each of the three realms has roots of merit obtained from birth and roots of merit from practice.üîΩSince it is not known which are which,

original: de dag gang dag yin pa mi shes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gang dag yin pa mi shes pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gcig ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gcig ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are not possessed in the form and formless realms.

original: ldan pa gcod pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'dod na /
analyzed: ldan pa gcod pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the severance of the roots of virtue is the severance of possession,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang ni snga nas mi ldan pas de gcod pa mi srid do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang ni snga nas mi ldan pas de gcod pa mi srid do //
translated: it is impossible to sever those roots of virtue that are not possessed in the form and formless realms.

original: yang ji ltar na de'i thob pa thag sring bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de'i thob pa thag sring bar byed ce na /
translated: How do they sever the obtainment of those roots of virtue?

original: rgyud de'i snod ma yin pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsngar rgyud de dag gi thob pa rnams kyi snod du gyur pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad nas snod ma yin pa ste skal ba med pa nyid du byas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyud de'i snod ma yin pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro // sngar rgyud de dag gi thob pa rnams kyi snod du gyur pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad nas snod ma yin pa ste skal ba med pa nyid du byas pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because they make the mindstream an unsuitable vessel.üîΩPreviously, the mindstream was a suitable vessel for the obtainment of those roots of virtue. However, when the roots of virtue are severed, it becomes an unsuitable vessel, or an unfortunate vessel.

original: de dag gis thob pa thag sring ba byed pa las de dag kyang bcad pa yin no zhes brjod pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de dag gis thob pa thag sring ba byed pa las de dag kyang bcad pa yin no zhes brjod pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because they make the obtainment of those roots of virtue distant, they are said to sever those roots of virtue.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dag las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dag las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Those that arise from preparation are severed by wrong view.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dag ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dag ste /
translated: Those that arise from preparation are those obtained from hearing and contemplation.

original: log par lta ba 'byung ba'i sngar chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnas skabs kho nar dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis thob pa chod pas de'i phyir de dag log par lta bas mi gcod do //
analyzed: log par lta ba 'byung ba'i sngar chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnas skabs kho nar dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis thob pa chod pas de'i phyir de dag log par lta bas mi gcod do //
translated: Wrong view severs those roots of virtue that are obtained from hearing and contemplation, but it does not sever those obtained from preparation.

original: 'di ltar sdig pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa lta ci smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdig pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa lta ci smos so //
translated: Why is this? Because those who possess wrong view do not possess the intention to commit heinous acts.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang sdig pa'i bsam pa rgyas par 'phel pa de'i rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa nas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'grib par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang sdig pa'i bsam pa rgyas par 'phel pa de'i rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa nas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'grib par 'gyur la /
translated: Those who possess sinful friends increase and expand their sinful intentions and they establish the conditions for that, whereby their roots of virtue diminish and

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: their roots of nonvirtue increase.

original: de'i phyir nyid kyis rim gyis dge ba 'gribs shing mi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyid kyis rim gyis dge ba 'gribs shing mi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar gyur pa las /
translated: Therefore, through the gradual decrease of virtue and the increase of roots of nonvirtue,

original: de las dus shig tu rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba skye'o //
analyzed: de las dus shig tu rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba skye'o //
translated: At a certain point, the wrong view that denies cause and effect arises.

original: de log par lta ba des dge ba'i chos thams cad gtugs par 'gyur zhing de'i rgyud la dge ba mi gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de log par lta ba des dge ba'i chos thams cad gtugs par 'gyur zhing de'i rgyud la dge ba mi gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Through that wrong view, all virtuous entities are obstructed and virtuous entities do not remain in the mind continuum.

original: 'di tsam gyis dge ba chad pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis dge ba chad pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: One is said to have severed the wholesome roots to the extent that this occurs.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa ni bar chad med @71b pa'i lam lta bu yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa ni bar chad med @71b pa'i lam lta bu yin te /
translated: The wrong view that denies cause is like the uninterrupted path,

original: de dang lhan cig dge ba'i rtsa ba'i thob pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig dge ba'i rtsa ba'i thob pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of the roots of virtue is blocked at the same time.

original: 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin te /
translated: The wrong view that denies effect is like the liberated path,

original: de dang lhan cig de la skur pa 'debs pa'i thob pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig de la skur pa 'debs pa'i thob pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of the wrong view that denies cause arises at the same time.

original: dmigs pa'i dbye bas log par lta ba rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa kho nas yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dbye bas log par lta ba rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa kho nas yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: only having a contaminated object,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: meaning having an object of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: zag pa med la dmigs pas med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: zag pa med la dmigs pas med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: It is not the case that they do not have a uncontaminated object,

original: de la 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having taken cessation and the path as objects, one does not deny cause and effect.üîΩBecause those having a contaminated object are twofold, classified according to whether they take the same realm or different realms as objects, he says:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa yang skal pa mnyam pa dang skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pas rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa yang skal pa mnyam pa dang skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pas rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /

original: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa kho nas yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa kho nas yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is, it does not focus on the form and formless realms.

original: yang ci'i phyir gang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun tu mi gcod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun tu mi gcod ce na /
translated: Why does one not sever the roots of virtue by focusing on the uncontaminated and realms of different type?

original: de'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa tsam gyi sgo nas rgyas par nyam chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa tsam gyi sgo nas rgyas par nyam chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, they do not increase through mere concomitance because they are weak.

original: zag pa med pa dang gong ma'i yul can gyi log bar lta ba ni sems las byung ba gang dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag kho na la rgyas par gyur gyi dmigs pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang gong ma'i yul can gyi log bar lta ba ni sems las byung ba gang dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag kho na la rgyas par gyur gyi dmigs pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: Wrong view that focuses on the uncontaminated and higher realms increases only those mental factors with which it is concomitant, it does not increase its focal object.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi bar bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi bar bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term mere excludes increase through focal object.

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: This is said by Vaibhasikas.

original: kun gyi zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pas dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pas so //
analyzed: kun gyi zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pas dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pas so //
translated: All refers to those that focus on contaminated and uncontaminated states and those that focus on the same realm and different realms.

original: rnam pa dgu char yang @72a * //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu char yang @72a * //
translated: All nine types

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩchung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rnams las re re la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por phye bas rnam pa dgu yin no //üîΩji ltar mthong bas spang bar bya'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu char yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dag gis cig car spong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rnams las re re la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por phye bas rnam pa dgu yin no // ji ltar mthong bas spang bar bya'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu char yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dag gis cig car spong ba de bzhin du /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu char yang log par lta ba chen pos cig car kun tu gcod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams de skad ces zer /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu char yang log par lta ba chen pos cig car kun tu gcod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams de skad ces zer /

original: de ltar na gzhung 'di skyabs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung 'di skyabs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /

original: gal te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ltar rim gyis kun tu 'chad kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ltar rim gyis kun tu 'chad kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were severed gradually, like the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, it would not be severed in any other way.

original: 'o na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chen pos zhes bya ba ni gal te rim gyis yin na'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chen pos zhes bya ba ni gal te rim gyis yin na'o //

analyzed: de yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du rim gyis kun tu gcod pa la 'gal ba med do //

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //

analyzed: sngar sdom pa spong la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The former is the result of the mind derived from preparation because it is the result of the mind derived from preparation.

original: phyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun tu gcod do zhes bya ba ni skyes nas thob pa rnams kho na kun tu 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun tu gcod do zhes bya ba ni skyes nas thob pa rnams kho na kun tu 'chad pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di skad ces bya ba bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: This is the system of the Vaibhasikas.

original: sdom pa sems gang gi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdom pa sems gang gi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis te skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis te skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mind is twofold: obtained from birth and derived from preparation.

original: de re re la yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de re re la yang rnam pa dgu ste /

original: de la sdom pa sems gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de spangs pas /
analyzed: de la sdom pa sems gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de spangs pas /

original: de'i 'bras bu sdom pa yang gtong ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu sdom pa yang gtong ngo //
translated: then the result of that mind, the vows, are also relinquished.

original: de la gal te skyes nas thob pa'i sems chung ngu'i chung ngus sdom pa mnos na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te skyes nas thob pa'i sems chung ngu'i chung ngus sdom pa mnos na ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir cig car dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu 'chad pa dang sdom pa gtong ba yin no //

analyzed: gal te gzhan dag gis mnos na ni de'i phyir sngar sdom pa gtong la /
translated: If one takes vows with another mind, then one relinquishes vows first.

analyzed: phyis dge ba'i rtsa ba @72b kun tu chad pas 'tha' gcig tu smra bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that they are exclusively speakers, because they sever the root of virtue later.

original: shes rab nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dag mi brtan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dag mi brtan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag pos nyen pa'i phyir dmyal ba dang yi dags dag na yang mi brtan pa /
translated: It is not taught that they have wisdom in the hells and ghost realms, because they are afflicted by intense feelings of suffering.

original: gti mug shas che ba'i phyir dud 'gro dag na yang ma bstan no //üîΩlas kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lha'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa la bdag gang nas shi 'phos /
analyzed: gti mug shas che ba'i phyir dud 'gro dag na yang ma bstan no // las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lha'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa la bdag gang nas shi 'phos /
translated: It is not taught that they have wisdom in the animal realm, because delusion predominates there.üîΩBecause the results of karma are directly perceived.üîΩThe three thoughts arise for a newly born god: ‚ÄúI have died from somewhere,

original: gang du ni skyes las ni gang zhig gis skyes snyam pa'i sems gsum kun tu 'byung la /
analyzed: gang du ni skyes las ni gang zhig gis skyes snyam pa'i sems gsum kun tu 'byung la /
translated: I have been born somewhere, and I have been born due to some karma.‚Äù

original: de yang thams cad shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang thams cad shes pa yin no //
translated: And all of them know that.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan rang bzhin gyis bsam pa bzang ba'i phyir sdig pa'i bsam pa med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan rang bzhin gyis bsam pa bzang ba'i phyir sdig pa'i bsam pa med do //
translated: It is not taught that they have evil thoughts in Kuru because their minds are naturally good.

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling kho na na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams khyad par du rtog ge pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only in Jambudvƒ´pa, because the inhabitants of Jambudvƒ´pa are particularly intelligent.

original: thams cad las nyung na dbang po brgyad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad las nyung na dbang po brgyad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When they have fewer than all, they have eight faculties.

analyzed: lus dang tshor ba rnams dang srog dang yid dang ldan no //
translated: They have the body faculty, the four faculties of feeling, the vitality faculty, and the mental faculty.

analyzed: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang shes rab zhan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: blo 'dod chags kyis cher zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad rnams dang ldan zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: sdig pa'i bsam pa ste brnag pa'o //

analyzed: de yang rgyun chags su nges par rtog pas rgyun gcad par dka' ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //

analyzed: lta ba ring du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'chab pas na mkhyud pa'o //

original: mtshams med pa byed pa 'di la min /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa 'di la min /

analyzed: de ni rkyen gyi stobs kyis skyes pa'i log par lta ba yang mi gtong ste /
translated: Because he does not abandon wrong view that arises by the power of conditions,

analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la 'jig pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig rgyu'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig rang gi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi rtogs pa'i stobs kyis so //

analyzed: bsam pa nyams pas zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba mngon sum du gyur pas bsam pa nyams pa'o //

analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba nyams pa ni log par lta zhing mtshams med pa byed pa'o //

translated: Any who degenerate in view and so on.üîΩAny who sever their root of virtue through degenerating in view alone will reconnect with their root of virtue in this life alone.

analyzed: gang zhig lta ba dang tshul khrims nyams pas gcod par byed pa de ni lus zhig nas so //
translated: Any who sever their root of virtue through degenerating in view and ethics will reconnect with their root of virtue after death.

original: mu dang po ni rdzogs byed la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu dang po ni rdzogs byed la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first possibility is P≈´ra·πáa and so on, because they degenerate in view.

original: gnyis pa ni ma skyes dgra'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ma skyes dgra'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is AjƒÅta≈õatru, because he commits heinous acts.

original: gsum pa ni lhas sbyin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyams pa'i phyir dang mtshams med pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni lhas sbyin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyams pa'i phyir dang mtshams med pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is Devadatta, because he damaged his view and he committed an immediate misdeed.

original: las kyi lam du zhig dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: las kyi lam du zhig dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How many virtuous and nonvirtuous karmic paths arise simultaneously with intention?

original: las kyi lam dge ba dang mi dge ba du dag gcig dang / sems pa dge ba'am mi dge ba 'am /
analyzed: las kyi lam dge ba dang mi dge ba du dag gcig dang / sems pa dge ba'am mi dge ba 'am /
translated: How many virtuous and nonvirtuous karmic paths arise simultaneously with virtuous or nonvirtuous or neutral intention?

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang rung ba lhan cig 'byung zhes bya'o //üîΩgzhan med par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang rung ba lhan cig 'byung zhes bya'o // gzhan med par zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are said to arise simultaneously.

original: las kyi lam gzhan mthar phyin pa na yang brnab sems la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gzhan med par zhes bya ba smos so ;üîΩ/ sems pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las kyi lam gzhan mthar phyin pa na yang brnab sems la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gzhan med par zhes bya ba smos so ; / sems pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since covetousness and so on exist when other karmic paths are completed, the root text states, ‚Äúwithout another.‚Äù

original: sems pa dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Non-afflicted intention refers to virtuous and neutral intention.

analyzed: nga rgyal dang the tshom la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi sems pa yang der sbyor bar byed pa /

analyzed: gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba mthar phyin par 'gyur ba la /
translated: From among those with form, any one of them can be perfected.üîΩ

original: las kyi lam sems pa gcig dang lhan cig 'jug go //
analyzed: las kyi lam sems pa gcig dang lhan cig 'jug go //
translated: The mental action of intention occurs simultaneously with any of the manifest actions of killing and so on, when the action is completed.

original: gzhan dag na re myur bar bgrod pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re myur bar bgrod pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is swift.

original: gzugs can rnams las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: The manifest actions are the five actions of killing and so on, excluding sexual misconduct.

original: gnod sems su gyur pa srog @73b gcod pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis srog gcod pa mthar phyin pas de'i tshe gdon mi za bar srog gcod pa dang gnod sems dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnod sems su gyur pa srog @73b gcod pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis srog gcod pa mthar phyin pas de'i tshe gdon mi za bar srog gcod pa dang gnod sems dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: When killing is completed through anger, then at that time intention and the manifest actions of killing and malice definitely occur simultaneously.

original: brnab sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ma byin par len pa dang log par g-yem pa gnyis chags pas mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir gnyis dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ste /üîΩbrnab sems dang ma byin par len pa'am /

translated: When taking what is not given and sexual misconduct are completed through attachment, then at that time intention and the two manifest actions occur simultaneously, because they are completed through attachment.üîΩWhen killing is completed through attachment, then at that time intention and the manifest action of killing occur simultaneously, because they are completed through attachment.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang ngo //
translated: When killing is completed through delusion, then at that time intention and the manifest action of killing occur simultaneously, because they are completed through delusion.üîΩWhen killing is completed through a mixture of the three poisons, then at that time intention and the manifest action of killing occur simultaneously, because they are completed through a mixture of the three poisons.

original: bdun dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni @75b dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdun dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni @75b dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Seven arising simultaneously with intention is extensively explained as ‚Äúwhen abiding in virtuous mental consciousness.‚Äù

original: de las yang dge ba'i lta ba bla lhag tu bsnan te bdun dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las yang dge ba'i lta ba bla lhag tu bsnan te bdun dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, since right view is added to those six, they arise simultaneously with seven.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It continues, ‚ÄúOne possessing a nonvirtuous or neutral mind.‚Äù

original: de la ni yid kyi brnab sems med pa la sogs pa med la /
analyzed: de la ni yid kyi brnab sems med pa la sogs pa med la /
translated: One possessing a nonvirtuous or neutral mind does not possess the seven such as noncovetousness.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa yang spong ba bdun gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bdun kho na dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo /üîΩdgu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa yang spong ba bdun gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bdun kho na dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo / dgu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one who possesses the vows of a fully ordained monk generates the seven such as abandoning taking life, he generates them simultaneously with intention alone, because the vows of a fully ordained monk are by nature the seven abandonments.

original: dge slong gi sdom pas bsdus pa spong ba bdun dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pas bsdus pa spong ba bdun dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang yin te /
translated: When one who possesses the five sense consciousnesses that are virtuous generates the seven such as abandoning taking life, he generates them simultaneously with nine mental factors, because he possesses the seven such as abandoning taking life that are subsumed by the vows of a fully ordained monk, noncovetousness and nonmalice.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But he does not possess right view.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas bsdus pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na dgu dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas bsdus pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na dgu dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: When one who possesses mental consciousness subsumed by the knowledge of elimination and nonarising generates the seven such as abandoning taking life that are subsumed by the vows of a fully ordained monk, he generates them simultaneously with nine mental factors, because he possesses the seven such as abandoning taking life that are subsumed by the vows of a fully ordained monk, noncovetousness and nonmalice.üîΩBut he does not possess right view.

original: de la ni dge slong gi sdom pas bsdus pas gzugs can bdun dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ni dge slong gi sdom pas bsdus pas gzugs can bdun dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The seven material forms are included in the bhiksu vow, and non-covetousness and non-ill will occur.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthat which is included in the absorptions.‚Äù

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i la gnas pa ni dgu dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i la gnas pa ni dgu dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
translated: One who is established in the absorption that is concomitant with the cognition of exhaustion and non-arising and the mental consciousness that is included in the absorptions arises together with nine.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa med kyang snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa med kyang snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that one does not take up the bhiksu vow.

original: de la ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i bdun dang brnab sems med pa la sogs pa yod do //
analyzed: de la ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i bdun dang brnab sems med pa la sogs pa yod do //
translated: There are seven that are included in the uncontaminated vow, and non-covetousness and so on.

original: bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is included in the absorptions is stated

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to distinguish it from that which is included in the formless realm.

original: bcu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ni de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ni de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which arises together with ten is other than that.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa las gzhan pa'i dge ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa las gzhan pa'i dge ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the virtuous mental consciousness concomitant with the knowledge of elimination and nonarising, but other than that.

original: ci thams cad kyi tshe 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa la gnas pa bzhi bcu dang lhan cig 'byung ngam @76a * //
analyzed: ci thams cad kyi tshe 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa la gnas pa bzhi bcu dang lhan cig 'byung ngam @76a * //
translated: Do the forty that exist in the desire realm and form realm always occur simultaneously?

original: zhe na ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe na ma yin no //
translated: No, they do not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa kho na'o //
translated: But they do when one who is a fully ordained monk takes the vows of a novice and fully ordained monk.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dgu dang zhes de dag gi tshul ni bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dgu dang zhes de dag gi tshul ni bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase except for the knowledge of elimination and nonarising refers to the nine that have already been explained.

original: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gzhan lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems pa thams cad ces bya ba ni bcu dang lhan cig go zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gzhan lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems pa thams cad ces bya ba ni bcu dang lhan cig go zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase all the intentions that occur simultaneously with the other vows of absorption and uncontaminated vows refers to the ten that occur simultaneously.

original: re zhig 'di sdom pas bsdus pa las kyi lam rnams kyis nges pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di sdom pas bsdus pa las kyi lam rnams kyis nges pa yin no //
translated: This is the rule for the paths of action that are subsumed by the vows.

original: sems gzhan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems gzhan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase possessing another mind refers to

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One possesses a nonvirtuous or neutral mind.

original: spong ba'i yan lag gcig yang dag par len na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spong ba'i yan lag gcig yang dag par len na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one undertakes one branch of abandoning.

original: srog gcod pa 'am ma byin par len pa'i yan lag gcig spong ba yang dag par len pa na gcig kho na dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: srog gcod pa 'am ma byin par len pa'i yan lag gcig spong ba yang dag par len pa na gcig kho na dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: When one undertakes the branch of abandoning killing or stealing, then it occurs simultaneously with one volition.

original: gnyis dang lnga yang dag par len pa na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis dang lnga yang dag par len pa na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one undertakes two or five.

original: yan lag gnyis yang dag par len pa na ni lnga dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis yang dag par len pa na ni lnga dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
translated: When one undertakes two branches, then it occurs simultaneously with five,

original: yid kyi gsum dang lus dang ngag gi gnyis dang ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi gsum dang lus dang ngag gi gnyis dang ngo //
translated: the three of mind and the two of body and speech.

original: yan lag lnga yang dag par len pha na ni brgyad dang lhan cig cig car 'byung ste /
analyzed: yan lag lnga yang dag par len pha na ni brgyad dang lhan cig cig car 'byung ste /
translated: When one undertakes five branches, then it occurs simultaneously with eight,

original: de la ni gzugs can lnga dang yid kyi gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ni gzugs can lnga dang yid kyi gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: because the five physical ones and the three of mind occur.

original: phan tshun brgyad bkag byed pa'i phyir tshig rtsub mo yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phan tshun brgyad bkag byed pa'i phyir tshig rtsub mo yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Harsh speech is mutually obstructing speech.

original: sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa'i dmyal ba rnams dmyal srung dag la spyo bar byed la /üîΩdmyal srung dag kyang dmyal ba rnams la spyo ba 'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa'i dmyal ba rnams dmyal srung dag la spyo bar byed la / dmyal srung dag kyang dmyal ba rnams la spyo ba 'am /
translated: The hell beings who are tormented by suffering reproach the hell guardians.üîΩThe hell guardians also reproach the hell beings.

original: dmyal ba rnams kho na phan tshun spyo ba'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams kho na phan tshun spyo ba'o //
translated: Or the hell beings reproach one another.

original: rgyud rtsub pos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyud rtsub pos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that the continuum is rough because

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas zil gyis non pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas zil gyis non pa'i phyir te /
translated: they are overwhelmed by the feeling of suffering.üîΩBecause there is nothing pleasant,

original: yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing to be attached to,

original: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas brnab sems kun tu spyod pa med do //
analyzed: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas brnab sems kun tu spyod pa med do //
translated: there is no covetousness in the desire realm.

original: las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir log par lta ba med do //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir log par lta ba med do //
translated: Because the result of action is manifest, there is no wrong view.

original: 'du shes rgud pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba med do //
analyzed: 'du shes rgud pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba med do //
translated: Because the perception is impaired, there is no lying.

original: de dag rtag pa kho na 'du shes pas de na brdzun du smra ba med do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: de dag rtag pa kho na 'du shes pas de na brdzun du smra ba med do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that there is no lying because they always have the perception of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of that,

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir phra ma med pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir phra ma med pa'o //
translated: There is no slander because there is no need for it.

original: rtag tu bye zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni de na yul med pa'i @76b phyir phra ma med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rtag tu bye zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni de na yul med pa'i @76b phyir phra ma med do zhes bstan to //
translated: Because there is no object there, it is taught that there is no slander because it is always already divided.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir brnab sems mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas med do //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir brnab sems mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas med do //
translated: There is no covetousness because there is no possessiveness.

original: 'jam pa'i phyir dang kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gnod sems med de /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i phyir dang kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gnod sems med de /
translated: There is no malice because there is no anger and because there is no basis for malice.

original: gnod sems ni rgyu'i stobs dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye na de gnyi ga yang de na med do //
analyzed: gnod sems ni rgyu'i stobs dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye na de gnyi ga yang de na med do //
translated: Malice arises through the power of cause and the power of condition. Both of these are absent there.

original: de'i phyir gnod sems mngon du gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod sems mngon du gyur pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no manifest malice.

original: sdig pa can gyi bsam pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa drug kyang ldan pa'i sgo nas med cing mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang med do //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi bsam pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa drug kyang ldan pa'i sgo nas med cing mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang med do //
translated: The six, such as killing, are not possessed and are not manifest because there is no sinful intention.

original: 'dod pa na gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba med ces nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba med ces nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is certain that form does not arise prior to desire.

original: gzhan yang tshe nges pa'i phyir srog gcod pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshe nges pa'i phyir srog gcod pa med do //
translated: Also, killing does not exist there because the life span is fixed.

original: rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag med do //
analyzed: rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag med do //
translated: Taking what is not given and sexual misconduct do not exist there because there is no ownership of property or women.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang tshig rtsub mo dag med do //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang tshig rtsub mo dag med do //
translated: Lying, malicious speech, and harsh speech do not exist there because there is no need for them.

original: ji ltar 'di dag mi tshangs par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag mi tshangs par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How can they be unchaste?

original: gal te bud med yongs su gzung ba med na snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bud med yongs su gzung ba med na snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If there is no ownership of women.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, they are not unchaste from the point of view of direct perception.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ldan pa'i sgo nas kyang med ces bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ldan pa'i sgo nas kyang med ces bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Also means that they are not unchaste from the point of view of possession.

original: dud 'gro dang yi dags dang lha dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dud 'gro dang yi dags dang lha dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nonrestraint does not exist among animals, ghosts, and gods.

original: 'di ltar mi rnams kho na la sdom pa ma yin pa 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rnams kho na la sdom pa ma yin pa 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Nonrestraint is asserted to exist only among humans, not among others.

original: mi dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'o //
