translated: eunuchs, hermaphrodites, and those who have two sets of sexual organs.

original: sdom pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdom pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the reason that they are not vessels for the precepts.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa med pa dang / @85b lus zhing tshva sgo can dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa med pa dang / @85b lus zhing tshva sgo can dang 'dra'o //
translated: They are not vessels for the precepts because they lack a sense of shame and moral dread, and because their bodies are like a field of excrement.

original: gal te lus ma tshang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan pa chung ba nyid yin na dmus long la sogs pa dag la yang mtshams med pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus ma tshang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan pa chung ba nyid yin na dmus long la sogs pa dag la yang mtshams med pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the reason is that they are of little benefit because they are incomplete in body, then even the blind, etc., would not be vessels for the precepts.

original: za ma la sogs pa'i lus ni rtogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir mtshang bar 'dod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: za ma la sogs pa'i lus ni rtogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir mtshang bar 'dod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
translated: The bodies of eunuchs, etc., are considered incomplete because they are incompatible with the realization of the noble path, but not for any other reason.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang dud 'gro rnams la yang phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang dud 'gro rnams la yang phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: For the same reason, pretas and animals are not considered vessels for the precepts, because they are of little benefit and have little shame.

original: ji ltar phan pa chung ba nyid yin zhe na 'gro ba ngan pas bsdus pa'i lus kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phan pa chung ba nyid yin zhe na 'gro ba ngan pas bsdus pa'i lus kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How are they of little benefit? Because they are included in the evil destinies and because they are the cause of an incomplete body.

original: rta cang shes bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rta kha cig cang shes yin pa'i phyir ma la mi rgol lo zhes grag go / mi'i yang pha ma mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rta cang shes bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rta kha cig cang shes yin pa'i phyir ma la mi rgol lo zhes grag go / mi'i yang pha ma mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: A human who has nonhuman parents is also not a fit vessel, because they have little benefit and shame.

original: mi ma yin pas ni mi dang mthun pa'i phan pa byed par mi nus la /
analyzed: mi ma yin pas ni mi dang mthun pa'i phan pa byed par mi nus la /
translated: Nonhumans are not able to benefit humans in a way that is consistent with humans.

original: pha ma mi ma yin pa dag gis gam du mi la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas chen po yang nas yang du gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: pha ma mi ma yin pa dag gis gam du mi la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas chen po yang nas yang du gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nonhuman parents do not repeatedly abide with humans in a great way, with shame and embarrassment.

original: sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni bden pa dag mthong bar mi nus pas rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni bden pa dag mthong bar mi nus pas rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Beings of Kuru and beings devoid of discernment are not vessels for seeing the four truths, because they are obscured by karmic maturation.

original: gling gsum gyi za ma la sogs pa'i rten yang 'phags pa'i lam gyi snod ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gling gsum gyi za ma la sogs pa'i rten yang 'phags pa'i lam gyi snod ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Aren't the faculties of neuters in the three continents also obscured by karmic maturation, because they are not vessels for the arya path?

original: za ma dang ma ning la sogs pa'i rten de nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam rtogs par nus pa med do //
analyzed: za ma dang ma ning la sogs pa'i rten de nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam rtogs par nus pa med do //
translated: The very same basis of a neuter, eunuch, etc. is incapable of realizing the noble path.

original: ngan song rnams dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyis kyang mi nus te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song rnams dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyis kyang mi nus te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, those in the unfortunate realms, those in Uttarakuru, and the beings devoid of ideation are incapable of realizing the noble path because they are confused.

original: 'di nyid rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: This is the obscuration to the result of karma.

original: ngan song nyid la sogs pa'i so so skye bo'i sa rnams rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa nyid kyis brjod do //
analyzed: ngan song nyid la sogs pa'i so so skye bo'i sa rnams rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa nyid kyis brjod do //
translated: The stages of ordinary beings, such as the unfortunate realms, etc. are described as the obscuration to the result of karma.

original: gzhan ni 'phags pa'i gang zag dang thun mong pa'i sa yin pas rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa nyid du ma bshad do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'phags pa'i gang zag dang thun mong pa'i sa yin pas rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa nyid du ma bshad do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that the other stages are not described as the obscuration to the result of karma because they are common to the noble persons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nye bar mi brdzi ba'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nye bar mi brdzi ba'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are not subject to regression.

original: rab 'grongs pa'i phyir de dag la gzhan dag gis mi brdzi'o //
analyzed: rab 'grongs pa'i phyir de dag la gzhan dag gis mi brdzi'o //
translated: They are not subject to regression because they are excellent.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Assigning the result to the cause is lying, which is the cause of schism in the Sa·πÖgha.

original: rgyu de la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir dge 'dun dbyen mtshams med @86a * //üîΩpar bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu de la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir dge 'dun dbyen mtshams med @86a * // par bshad do //
translated: Since the result is assigned to the cause, schism in the Sa·πÖgha is explained as a heinous karma.

original: 'dis 'byed par byed pas na zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos kho nar dge 'dun gyi dbyen yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dis 'byed par byed pas na zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos kho nar dge 'dun gyi dbyen yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that schism in the Sa·πÖgha is the actual heinous karma.

original: de ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa ni mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: de ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa ni mi dge ba yin la /
translated: How can it be a heinous karma?

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Heinous karma is nonvirtuous, but schism in the Sa·πÖgha is unobscured neutral.

original: 'byed pa po ni mtshams med pa dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: 'byed pa po ni mtshams med pa dang ldan gyi /
translated: One who causes a schism possesses a heinous karma,

original: 'byed pa po phye ba dang ni mi ldan pas dge 'dun gyi dbyen mtshams med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byed pa po phye ba dang ni mi ldan pas dge 'dun gyi dbyen mtshams med pa ma yin no //
translated: but one who is split by the schismatic does not possess a heinous karma.

original: bar gyi bskal pa zhes bya ba ni bskal ba chen po ma yin te /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa zhes bya ba ni bskal ba chen po ma yin te /
translated: An intermediate eon is not a great eon.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na tshe'i tshad de tsam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na tshe'i tshad de tsam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the life span in the desire realm is not that long.üîΩMoreover, one who has committed many heinous acts...

original: yang gang gis mtshams med pa mang po byas pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dngos po kho nas dmyal ba dag tu skye ba 'phangs pas ji ltar gzhan dag don med par mi 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yang gang gis mtshams med pa mang po byas pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dngos po kho nas dmyal ba dag tu skye ba 'phangs pas ji ltar gzhan dag don med par mi 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the above is that if one is born in hell due to the karma of a single heinous act, then why would other heinous acts be meaningless?

original: don med pa ste gang gi phyir gcig gis skye ba 'phangs pa las /
analyzed: don med pa ste gang gi phyir gcig gis skye ba 'phangs pa las /
translated: They are not meaningless, because due to one heinous act,üîΩone is born in a great hell and due to another,

original: lhags pas gnod pa lhags par 'gyur //
analyzed: lhags pas gnod pa lhags par 'gyur //
translated: one experiences great harm.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni ches che ba'o //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni ches che ba'o //
translated: Great means very great.

original: gang yang mtshams med pa'i las gzhan gyi dmyal bar skye bar so sor nges par gyur pa las /
analyzed: gang yang mtshams med pa'i las gzhan gyi dmyal bar skye bar so sor nges par gyur pa las /
translated: Moreover, if one is definitely born in hell due to the karma of a single heinous act,

original: phyis mtshams med pas ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis mtshams med pas ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur /
translated: how could one later commit another heinous act?

original: mtshams med pa las grol te las kyis dmyal bar skye ba 'phangs pa ni de srid mtshams med pa byas pas kyang ste de ni snga ma bzhin du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa las grol te las kyis dmyal bar skye ba 'phangs pa ni de srid mtshams med pa byas pas kyang ste de ni snga ma bzhin du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is freed from a heinous act and is born in hell due to the karma of a heinous act would not be born there due to the karma of a heinous act, because that karma would be like the previous karma that was relinquished.

original: dper na mtshams med la gzhan gyis 'phangs pa'i mtshams med pa bzhin no //üîΩgzhan dag na re 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa smin par byed pa ma yin no /
analyzed: dper na mtshams med la gzhan gyis 'phangs pa'i mtshams med pa bzhin no // gzhan dag na re 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa smin par byed pa ma yin no /
translated: For example, it is like the immediate karmas that are projected by others.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The projecting karma does not ripen.

original: khyim pa yang ma yin la dge slong ma la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi lus mi gnyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim pa yang ma yin la dge slong ma la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi lus mi gnyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is neither a layperson nor a fully ordained monk, etc., because their bodies are not respected.

original: de yang lta ba spyad pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang mkhyud pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang lta ba spyad pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang mkhyud pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, he is only one who practices view, because his evil thoughts are firm and continuous.

original: sred pa sbyang pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dag la bsam pa mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa sbyang pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dag la bsam pa mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not one who practices craving, because his thoughts are not firm with regard to the factors of affliction and purification.

original: bzod par dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod par dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to bear, because it is difficult to overcome.

original: chos mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i chos su dag mngon sum du byas @86b pa'i phyir dang dad pa mi phyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i chos su dag mngon sum du byas @86b pa'i phyir dang dad pa mi phyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Dharma of scripture and the Dharma of realization are directly perceived and because they possess indivisible faith.

original: bzod pa thob pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzod pa chen po thob pa rnams te /
analyzed: bzod pa thob pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzod pa chen po thob pa rnams te /
translated: Those who have obtained acceptance do not,

original: mthong ba'i lam nye zhing nges pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlam 'jug pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun bye ba lam 'jug pa'i gegs nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam nye zhing nges pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro // lam 'jug pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun bye ba lam 'jug pa'i gegs nyid du gyur te /
translated: because those who have obtained great acceptance are near the path of seeing and directly face it.üîΩBecause it obstructs entry to the path.üîΩA schism in the Sa·πÖgha obstructs entry to the path because it obstructs entry to the path of the noble ones, since it causes entry to another path that is not noble.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i lam gzhan zhugs pas dam par gyur pa'i lam 'jug pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir gegs nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / lhas byin gyis ni nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir lam gzhi lnga pa bstan te /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i lam gzhan zhugs pas dam par gyur pa'i lam 'jug pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir gegs nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / lhas byin gyis ni nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir lam gzhi lnga pa bstan te /
translated: Devadatta taught the five points as the path to liberation.

original: 'o ma mi spyad pa dang / sha spang ba dang / lan tshva nye bar longs mi spyad pa dang / gos ma dras pa bgos pa dang / grong gi nang gi gtsug lag khang du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma mi spyad pa dang / sha spang ba dang / lan tshva nye bar longs mi spyad pa dang / gos ma dras pa bgos pa dang / grong gi nang gi gtsug lag khang du 'dug pa'o //
translated: not to drink milk, not to eat meat, not to eat salt, to wear uncut cloth, and to live in a temple in the village.

original: gling gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gling gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i nges pa yin no //
translated: There is no other continent where the Buddha appears.

original: gang na ston pa bzhugs pa de na ston pa'i 'gran zla gnas kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na ston pa bzhugs pa de na ston pa'i 'gran zla gnas kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Where the Teacher is, there is the rival of the Teacher, but not elsewhere.

original: gdon mi za bar dge 'dun phyogs gnyis su gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dge 'dun phyogs gnyis su gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Sangha necessarily splits into two factions.

original: 'dir bzhi sde la dge 'dun du mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir bzhi sde la dge 'dun du mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the four assemblies are considered to be the Sangha.

original: brgyad dag dang lhags pa dag gis kyang yin te byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyad dag dang lhags pa dag gis kyang yin te byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eight and those who have arrived are also the Sangha, because there is no agent.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe sngar med pa'i chos byung ba la dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba skye bas thams cad bsam pa dge ba'i phyir sha gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe sngar med pa'i chos byung ba la dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba skye bas thams cad bsam pa dge ba'i phyir sha gcig pa yin no //
translated: At first, all are of the same flesh, because they are of virtuous intention, since joy and supreme joy arise from the appearance of the Dharma that did not exist before at that time.

original: mthar yang ston pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: mthar yang ston pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: and finally, they will be separated from the Teacher.

original: skyo ba'i phyir sha gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: skyo ba'i phyir sha gcig pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because of their sadness, the Sangha is said to be ‚Äúof one flesh.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe bstan pa 'phel zhing rgyas par gnas pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan pa 'phel zhing rgyas par gnas pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Also, at that time, the teaching does not remain widespread and flourishing.

original: sha gcig ces bya ba ni blo gcig cing mi mthun pa med ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sha gcig ces bya ba ni blo gcig cing mi mthun pa med ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúOf one flesh‚Äù means of one mind, without disagreement.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun mthun pa na sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun mthun pa na sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sangha of monks is in agreement when the Buddhas attain final Nirvana.

original: gzhan dag na re chos nyid kyi nges pas 'khor rnams skyo ba la sogs pa'i phyir mtha' ma yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos nyid kyi nges pas 'khor rnams skyo ba la sogs pa'i phyir mtha' ma yin zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The end is because of the sadness of the retinue, etc., by the rule of the intrinsic meaning.

original: bar du yang skyon ma byung ba'i snga rol du zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang tshul khrims rnam par 'gyur ba dmigs pas 'byed pa po'i tshig gi glags yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar du yang skyon ma byung ba'i snga rol du zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang tshul khrims rnam par 'gyur ba dmigs pas 'byed pa po'i tshig gi glags yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, in the middle, before the arising of a fault, the words of a divider are possible, because the division is observed by the change of view and morality.

analyzed: de la lta ba'i skyon ni ji skad du bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: The fault of view is as follows: ‚ÄúAccording to my understanding of the meaning explained by the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang @87a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang @87a * //
translated: The Blessed One has said that those things which are obstacles do not become obstacles when relied upon.

original: zhig bar du gcod pa'i chos su bka' stsal pa de dag ni brten na bar du gcod par mi 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sems de nyid kun tu rgyug 'khor bar 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhig bar du gcod pa'i chos su bka' stsal pa de dag ni brten na bar du gcod par mi 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sems de nyid kun tu rgyug 'khor bar 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: And similarly, that very mind runs and wanders in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: las la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gis slob ma dbye bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa de kho na'i dbye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gis slob ma dbye bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa de kho na'i dbye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it depends on karma. Only the one who has performed the action that will divide the disciples becomes divided, not another.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas kyang byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas kyang byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na /
translated: Even the Blessed One ≈öƒÅkyamuni, when he was a bodhisattva,

analyzed: drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa zhig gis 'khor phye ste /
translated: a sage with the five higher knowledges divided his retinue.

original: des na 'dir dge 'dun lhas byin gyis phye'o zhis grag go /'o na pha dang ma gang dag lto na gnas pa nyid gsod pa bzhugs pa dang / skyes ma thag tu khyi dang ce sbyangs srigs pa'i lam bo cher bor ba de dag ji ltar phan 'dogs pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'dir dge 'dun lhas byin gyis phye'o zhis grag go /'o na pha dang ma gang dag lto na gnas pa nyid gsod pa bzhugs pa dang / skyes ma thag tu khyi dang ce sbyangs srigs pa'i lam bo cher bor ba de dag ji ltar phan 'dogs pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But if the mother and father are killed while the child is still in the womb, or if the child is killed immediately after birth, or if a dog or jackal is thrown into a pit, how are they benefactors?

analyzed: de'i phyir de las lus skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smros so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause the body arises from them.‚Äù

analyzed: de dag kyang 'tsho ba med pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas de ltar zhugs kyi byams pas med pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: They engage in such acts due to fear of lack of livelihood and so on, but not due to love.
